text: Jayda Cheyni Pelaia-Hylton (born May 30, 1998), known as Jayda Hylton-Pelaia, is a Canadian-born Jamaican footballer who plays as a right back for the Jamaica women's national team. ==Early life and education== Hylton-Pelaia attends East Carolina University in Greenville, North Carolina, United States. ==International career== Hylton-Pelaia has represented Jamaica on the senior national team as well as the under-20 national team. She competed at the 2018 CONCACAF Women's U-20 Championship. She made her senior debut on 28 July 2019 against Mexico in the Pan American Games. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1998 births Category:Living people Category:Women's association football fullbacks Category:Jamaican women's footballers Category:Jamaica women's international footballers Category:Pan American Games competitors for Jamaica Category:Footballers at the 2019 Pan American Games Category:Jamaican people of Canadian descent Category:Jamaican people of Italian descent Category:East Carolina Pirates women's soccer players Category:Jamaican expatriate women's footballers Category:Jamaican expatriate sportspeople in the United States Category:Expatriate women's soccer players in the United States Category:Canadian women's soccer players Category:Soccer people from Ontario Category:Sportspeople from Brampton Category:Black Canadian sportspeople Category:Black Canadian women Category:Canadian people of Jamaican descent Category:Canadian people of Italian descent Category:Canadian expatriate soccer players Category:Canadian expatriate sportspeople in the United States
title: Jayda Hylton-Pelaia
